str2: Useless debate. From a compound of para and diatribo; misemployment, i.e. Meddlesomeness.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To destroy, waste; hence met: I corrupt. From diaballo and phtheiro; to rot thoroughly, i.e. to ruin.
Probably from the base of ginosko; the intellect, i.e. Mind; by implication, meaning.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To defraud, deprive of, despoil; mid: I endure deprivation; pass: To be bereft of. From apo and stereo; to despoil.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From nomos; properly, to do by law, i.e. To accustom; by extension, to deem or regard.
Piety (towards God), godliness, devotion, godliness. From eusebes; piety; specially, the gospel scheme.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A source of gain, livelihood. From a derivative of poros; furnishing, i.e. money-getting.
